result.execSummary:
The defendant Chris J Farnsworth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to Walworth County.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid as follows:  $559.95 to Target in Case 14CF143; $612 to Walmart in Case 14CF144 and $716 to Walmart in Case 13CF1501.  Restitution is to be paid as a Condition of Probation and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines.

   If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  DNA surcharge is waived.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with Target or Walmart.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Attend at least 2 self help meetings per week.

Cases 13CF1501 and 14CF144 were dismissed and read in.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED.
To be used at Agent's discretion and Agent to determine with or without non working hours.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on July 24, 2014 at 10:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Chris J Farnsworth in court with attorney Steven C McGaver.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant enters a plea of guilty to count #1.    The Court finds the Defendant guilty of Count #1. The charges in cases 2013CF1501 and 2014CF144 are dismissed and read in.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Plea hearing on June 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Chris J Farnsworth in court with attorney Jason D Luczak.  Debra L Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
Attonrey Luczak is appearing on behalf  Steven McGaver and is requesting a plea only.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant to have no contact with any Target or Walmart store.    Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Chris J Farnsworth in court with attorney Steven C. McGaver.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause and binds over the defendant for trial.  The state is requesting cash bail.  The defense is requesting a signature bond.
Court sets a signature bond.  Hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Defendant Chris J Farnsworth not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
